main_definition: A group of individuals born and living around the same period, often sharing common social experiences or characteristics.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A single instance of a particular generation, such as people who were born in the 1960s.
meanings_and_examples.example: The baby boomers are considered one generation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The length or duration of time it takes for all individuals in a given group to be born and reach adulthood.
meanings_and_examples.example: It took about three decades for the first wave of Generation X members to come of age.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of values, beliefs, or characteristics that are commonly shared among individuals within a generation.
meanings_and_examples.example: Generation Z grew up with technology and social media as integral parts of their lives.
